biography.value:
Sebastian Kowoll

One of the only draconic beings that makes its home in the Nine Hells, the Styx dragon is an aquatic creature that lives within the River Styx. The waters of the Styx have no effect on its mental faculties or memories, and their breath weapon replicates the effects of the Styx. Their diet consists mostly of devils foolish enough to wander close to the banks of the Styx, though they prefer mortals and corpses over Fiends. Occasional Styx dragons have been spotted in non-infernal planes, possibly by traveling the Styx to their destination.

Unusual Dragons p252[â€“]

Unlike other Dragons, the scales of the Styx dragon have no effect on their capabilities, and range from darker hues all the way up to chromatic scales, though they always appear muddied. They have no wings and very small limbs, relying primarily on their tails for mobility and combat. Their serpentine body lends itself to muddy nests along the banks of the Styx and quick underwater travel. Good captains know where Styx dragon clutches are along the river, and steer their boats specifically to avoid the creatures.

description.value: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks using its Bite, Tail, or a combination of the two. It can replace one of the attacks with Constrict.

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+14]]{+14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 ([[/damage 2d10 + 8 type=piercing]]) damage plus 7 ([[/damage 2d6 type=poison]]) damage, and the target must make a [[/save ability=constitution dc=19]] saving throw. On a failed save, the target contracts Stygian Wasting.

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+14]]{+14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 ([[/damage 2d6 + 8 type=bludgeoning]]) damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[condition=grappled] condition (escape DC 22). The dragon can't make a Tail attack while a creature is &Reference[condition=grappled] in this way.

The dragon tightens its grip on a creature &Reference[condition=grappled] by its tail. The creature takes 27 ([[/damage 3d12 + 8 type=bludgeoning]]) damage, has the &Reference[condition=restrained] condition until the start of the dragon's next turn, and must make a [[/save ability=constitution dc=19]] saving throw. On a failed save, the target contracts Stygian Wasting.

Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon must succeed on a [[/save ability=wisdom dc=18]] saving throw or have the &Reference[condition=frightened] condition for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

The dragon exhales poisonous Styx water in a 60-foot-long, 10-foot-wide line. Each creature in that line must make a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=19]] saving throw, taking 54 ([[/damage 12d8 type=poison]]) damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Creatures that fail the save contract Stygian Wasting.
The dragon can breathe air and water.

Creatures afflicted with this disease are incapable of regaining hit points in any way until the disease is cured. Additionally, as their flesh starts to rot, a creature with this disease takes 36 ([[/damage 8d8 type=necrotic]]) damage after each long rest they finish.
The dragon is immune to all negative effects from the River Styx.
The dragon makes a Wisdom (&Reference[skill=Perception]) check.
The dragon makes a Tail attack. If a creature is already &Reference[condition=grappled], the dragon may use Constrict instead.

If the dragon has successfully &Reference[condition=restrained] a creature with the Constrict ability, it may throw them up to 100 feet away. When it lands, the creature takes 21 ([[/damage 6d6 type=bludgeoning]]) damage and must make a [[/save ability=constitution dc=18]] saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the &Reference[condition=unconscious] condition for 10 minutes.

The styx dragon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The styx dragon regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

  • @UUID[Actor.rrmhkVxgecE6Oyba.Item.tpnQtgB8DD4qCyox]{Detect}
  • @UUID[Actor.rrmhkVxgecE6Oyba.Item.qINYFRhgGvQiPbCy]{Tail Attack}
  • @UUID[Actor.rrmhkVxgecE6Oyba.Item.iapUhsXP7udf2hYT]{Death Throw}
